content.question: The vector <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is given by <math alttext="vector v equals open angle brackets 5 cos open parentheses pi over 3 close parentheses comma 5 sin open parentheses pi over 3 close parentheses close angle brackets"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Which of the following describes <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> ?

choices.label: The magnitude of <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="square root of 5"><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt></math>, and the head of the vector points up and to the right.

The magnitude of <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="square root of 5"><msqrt><mn>5</mn></msqrt></math>, and the head of the vector points down and to the right.
The magnitude of <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math>, and the head of the vector points up and to the right.
The magnitude of <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math>, and the head of the vector points down and to the right.

content.answer: The magnitude of <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math>, and the head of the vector points up and to the right.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
